page.title: 01Cambridgeshire Fen Edge
page.content: This is almost flat land - average 3 metres ablve sea level - mainly class 1 arable on boulder clay subsoil but some black peat fen soil at E border and several small private woods in which Pheasants are reared for shooting. Main crops are cereals, sugarbeet, potatoes and oilseed rape. Farms are large mechanised and intensively cultivated. Fields are generally hedged. The London/Edenburgh railway runs non-stop N/S near W edge. At centre of E halfdd is "Pererborough Business Airport", for light aircraft. There is no other industry. There are two villages, Holme (pop. 570) at NE corner and Canington (pop 210) on S border; most inhabitants work outside the area. Parts of 3 other parishes Sawtry, Glatten and Denton & Caldecote
